annotation.TEXT: By the way, after SMW NES and Ninji Jump Alpha, it's so nice to be playing a game with normal SMW controls and physics!
So, that's two levels done...
Can't enter the building, I don't think.
But, what ever became of the trick-or-treaters, and did anything happen to Peach? Find out next time, if Meirdent ever makes a sequel!
And I happened to notice this Halloween hack yesterday that I haven't played yet, so here we go!
Ah, we've arrived at civilization at least. Perhaps the people here will know what has happened to the trick-or-treaters...
Okay, let's hope this shell (head) is perfect for these Thwomps... It better be, given the setup!
Anything up there? Well, maybe if I could shell-(head)-jump properly...
AND DEATH TO EVERYTHING ELSE WHILE I'M AT IT!
Huh. I wonder what's with the yellow outlines? Is there a Switch Palace in this hack? Well, for now, I'll just spin jump off the Boos.
Hello, and welcome to... (Drumroll please...)
..."Halloween in the Mushroom Kingdom"! Whoa, that's an extreme pixelated close up of Mario there!
Man, that poorly looping music is creeping me out and messing with my head (shell)!
Or... Not. It appears this place has been taken over by the undead as well...
Ooh, finally a power up appears! That... is a real power up mushroom, right? Yes, fortunately.
That should be spelled "criticism".
Okay, this shell (head) is useless for Thwomp-killing. I need a different one.
Just kidding! No offense to actual Democrats and Republicans!
I'm surprised I didn't screw that up and take damage!

So, it's Halloween, and I certainly wanted to do something for it this time, especially since last year, a certain winter storm gypped our area out of Halloween entirely! (Fortunately, Hurricane Sandy didn't screw me over.)
Nuts... The undead have taken over here, too. At least it's got the Peach's Castle music going, but it feels out of place now...
Gotta check every pipe...
Hey, let's get fancy here for no real reason!
Oh, this bloody music! Mind... Games... Mind... Games...
Oh, she's in the next room, and not in another castle? That's good.
Mmm... Brains...
Can I get a 1-up combo here?
Yes, that is exactly how you reattach a head to its body!
No, actually, they're Democrats and Republicans, not that there's much of a difference.
We've got SMB3 Airship music on the title screen here.
I wonder what this music is... I'm unsure on this one.
Okay, that's just me being stupid. (Maybe I haven't quite gotten used to normal SMW physics yet?)
I could go back for that mushroom, but it's probably not worth the trip at this point. And this shell (head) isn't worth a blasted thing against these Thwomps!
Oh, thank goodness!
This level appears to be a lot of the same thing: Zombie goombas, Toads that lose their heads, regular boney enemies, and some mildly tricky jumps.
That... can't be good. I don't want to have to kill a zombie Luigi!
Also, I think "treating." could've fit on the same line as "trick or", and that would've made this message look neater.
Oh, nice! That awful music is gone and replaced by the happy Yoshi theme from Tetris Attack!
And so we begin on Haunting Road...
Hey, shell-- I mean, head! You missed a goomba! ...Well, I guess that means I can carry it through the goal for a 1-up.
Oh, no! I've knocked this guy's head off! I'm so sorry! Here, let me give it back-- Oops! Sorry!
Hmm... Methinks that if I had followed that shell-- er, I mean head-- better, I could've gotten a 1-up combo.
Oh, but I guess it would've been safe to anyway, as they're not the breakable kind.

So, I guess that's it. There doesn't seem to be anywhere else to go, and I never found any Switch Palace, so I have no idea why those dotted blocks in Toad Town were there. (Maybe a Switch Palace was planned at one point?)
I'll skip that mushroom for now and come back for it later if needed.
Oh, I know! They've been kidnapped by ninjas! Am I a bad enough dude to rescue Halloween?
Oh, hey there Toads-- WAAH!!!
Ooh, a traditional goal! Also, I can convert this Toad head into a mushroom! (Wait, wasn't it already a mushroom? ...Oh, no! I've become a cannibal!)
My guess is that this road will be haunted, but I could be completely wrong...
However, they are the cheapskate kind. Come on, not even a coin? (Hey, didn't A Halloween Walk have a bunch of cheapskate blocks as well?)
What the heck? Did the music just loop incorrectly? Oh, man. Maybe the music does properly fit the theme now...
Uh, there's some Omnomnomers, better known as munchers.
No hidden 1-up or anything?
Man, what's happened to this place? This isn't the Peach's Castle that I know!
Alright, so that's one level out of three cleared. (The hack's length is supposedly three levels.)
Oh, yeah, and I do know this music. It's Marble Zone from Sonic 1. (You thought I forgot to mention the music, didn't you?)
No, I'm not going to be an idiot and spin jump those blocks. (You thought I was going to, didn't you?)
That's a funny way to spell "beginning"...
Yay for my shell (head) being in the right sprite slot to take out that Thwomp!
Surely people are still full of life in Peach's Castle, right?
Oh, come on. I can't even find a goomba in the right sprite slot?
Not from simply kicking the shell (er... head). I cartainly could by stomping the shell (I mean, head) repeatedly in the water, but I don't feel like wasting time with that.
Argh, that music... Mind... games... mind... games... mind... games...
Yeah, there doesn't seem to be much to say at this point as I continue to bash enemies' brains in.
Umm... Oh, my... Hey, goomba, you might want to get the back of your head checked out. I'm pretty sure having your brain exposed is not healthy.
YES! DEATH TO ALL THE THWOMPS! AAAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHHH!!!
Luigi! You're not a zombie too, are you?
Still a lot more of the same old stuff...
Well, that one was.
This should be "You're".
I hope you all enjoyed watching me play Halloween in the Mushroom Kingdom and almost lose my mind! Happy Halloween, and don't lose your head (shell)!
